newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek Silver & Baryte in new Bulgarian venture.
newsitem.headline: Greek Silver & Baryte in new Bulgarian venture.

text.p: Greece's ore processor Silver & Baryte is expanding its search for gold and copper in Bulgaria in association with the US-based Phelps Dodge, it said in a statement.
Silver & Baryte's 50 percent Bulgarian subsidiary Gramex and Phelps Dodge recently set up Sofia Mineral Ltd (Somin) to start exploration for gold and copper deposits in Bulgaria, it said.

Somin has secured permission from the Bulgarian authorities for gold and copper exploration in two areas, one in the southeastern and the other in the northern part of Bulgaria with respective surfaces of 2,645 and 600 square kilometres.
"Gramex believes the area of Buhovo Gorna Malina probably constitutes the extension of the Srednogoric volcanic belt which contains copper and gold deposits," Silver & Baryte said.
Somin will spend $0.35 million over the coming 18 months to explore those areas, it said. --Angelos Kiosklis, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
